sentences.english: They think little of the difficulties and setbacks on their way forward.
sentences.chinese: 他们对前进道路上的艰难险阻视若等闲。

sentences.english: They encountered untold difficulties and dangers before they reached their destination.
sentences.chinese: 他们经历过数不尽的艰难险阻才到达目的地。

sentences.english: Many difficulties and dangers attended upon his single-handed voyage round the world.
sentences.chinese: 他单独作环球旅行，遇到了许多艰难险阻。

sentences.english: Don't be a quitter at any time, even in face of immense difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 任何时候都不要轻易放弃，即使遇到了艰难险阻。

definition: lit. a path covered in brambles/a course of action beset by difficulties (idiom)
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
